title: retro

title: Cool
content: Yeah, I was once on that kind of thing too, it was fun. I got my chance to play real Space Invaders and oh boy was it fun! No wonder why people pushed thousands of coins in those machines. It's one of my favourite games. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Old arcade games are the best (right after Keen series).You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Yeah...
content:
I love arcade games!
Pacman, Digdug, space invaders, centipede, millipede, bosconian, galaxian, galaga, mario, donkey kong, asteroids - just to name a few! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

EDIT: There's these fun little joystick things called TVgames. They aren't all arcade games, but they have namco and atari. I have one with pacman, digdug, galaxian, rally-x (which i've never heard of), and bosconian (so fun!)!

My top 10 games are:

1. Bosconian (hours of fun!)
2. Centipede and/or millipede (got the 3D version! Fun!)
3. Pacman (gameboy or tv? either are fun!!)
4. Digdug (I "dig" this game!)
5. Galaxian (more fun than space invaders, IMO)
6. Space invaders (theres one in DOS called space commanders, the first one i played)
7. Galaga (w00t, fun! Never actually played it, though.)
8. Mario (fun! sorta)
9. Donkey Kong (played it on the internet, and in an arcade once)
10. Tetris (not really one of my favorites. I just couldn't think of 10)

The only games i've played/seen in an arcade are:
*Galaxian (only seen it. Never played it.)
*Centipede (either this or millipede. Cant remember)
*millipede (either this or centipede)
*donkey kong (i think i played it. Cant remember)
*pacman/ms. pacman (played)-Genius314

title: Re: Yeah...
content:
whoa I would love that portable ps2. Kingdom Hearts and Metal Gear solid 3 on the road! Anyways back on topic I find that I havnt played a good classic arcade game in awhile. I should try replaying pac man, Asteroids and Space Invaders. God I loved those games.Check out my blog at [url=http://spaces.msn.com/members/superadammario/]spaces.msn.com/members/superadammario/[/url]

title: Re: Yeah...
content:
Yeah, Pac-Man is very nice too. When I was small I remember playing some Pac-Man clone on my uncle's first computer (that was before our olde (and now gone) 286 [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] ).
Edit: No idea what computer that was. Nor where he had got the game.You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: Yeah...
content:
Pacman clones? I remember that, too. Of course none of my computers has a drive for those big floppy disks anymore [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dead.gif[/img]

I never know where i get games from. They just appeared there and i'd play them. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img]

EDIT: Just spent a half hour of playing arcade games! Fun!-Genius314

title: Re: Yeah...
content: Yeah, that machine had those good ol' big floppies too. Whatever the correct term is.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img] You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: Yeah...
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]those good ol' big floppies too. Whatever the correct term is[hr][/quote]You mean 5.25" floppies? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dexter.gif[/img] My 286 had one of those drives too...and it still does, and it still works. The hard drive blew up in it a couple of years ago, but it still works, it's just slower than it used to be - they don't make things like they used to [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img]

I've actually still got the first computer I ever owned - an Intel 8086 XT, with 640KB RAM and *two* 5.25" floppies (they were only 360K double-density drives though, I had to wait until my 286 before I had a 1.2MB high-density drive.) That was the first PC I ever played Commander Keen on. In hindsight I'm surprised it was actually fast enough to play Keen! Only the early Keens though, IIRC Keen 4+ were too big to fit on a single 360KB floppy. (And Keen Dreams didn't surface until many years later...)
